meanings.definition: Jilters: Those who abruptly end a romantic relationship.
meanings.sent1: Some people feel hurt when jilters end a relationship without warning.
meanings.sent2: She became one of the jilters when she decided to break up with him suddenly.
meanings.sent3: The jilters in the movie made the audience gasp at their unexpected actions.
meanings.sent4: The jilters were like sudden storms, leaving hearts in disarray.
meanings.sent5: The word 'jilters' always reminds me of those who leave love behind abruptly.

meanings.definition: Jilters: To abruptly end a romantic relationship.
meanings.sent1: He jilters his partners without considering their feelings.
meanings.sent2: She always jilters her boyfriends when she gets bored.
meanings.sent3: The character in the story jilters everyone, making it a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: His decision to jilters her was like a sharp knife through her heart.
meanings.sent5: The way he jilters people shows his lack of commitment and care.

meanings.definition: Jilters: The act of abruptly ending a romantic relationship.
meanings.sent1: The jilters of relationships often leave a trail of broken hearts.
meanings.sent2: She regretted the jilters she had done in the past.
meanings.sent3: The jilters at the party made for some interesting gossip later.
meanings.sent4: The jilters of love can sometimes be more painful than a slow breakup.
meanings.sent5: The sudden jilters in the story changed the course of the characters' lives.
